definition: Tables available to store instance data. Each table stores a collection of records. Each row corresponds to a single record, and each column corresponds to a field. Applications use tables and records to manage data and processes.
Controls to specify the properties of database tables and columns such as data type, length, and default value
Many-to-many relationship between two tables for allowing one table to be a related list of another
Controls to create a relationship between two data tables, which are required to display related lists
Controls to specify what fields to show on a form for a particular view or user
Controls to specify what columns to show on a list for a particular view or user
Controls to specify which list features are available such as displaying the New and Edit buttons
Related lists display records in another table that have a relationship to the current record. Users can view and modify information in related lists using standard list controls.
Controls to specify the CSS styling of a particular field
Controls to create a custom link in a list or form's contextual menu to perform a particular action
Controls to automatically set the Form View based on record field values
Custom Jelly-based HTML pages available to the system
Script-based controls for generating calendars and timelines
Record changes that occur between two predefined dates
Geographical maps to associate with records in the database
Controls to pre-populate particular forms with record data
Custom Jelly-based user interface elements available for lists, forms, and pages
Controls to specify what custom user interface to display on a particular form
Provides targeted help content to a user in a UI page, based on their role. Embedded Help Content appears in the right sidebar when the user clicks the help icon.

Provides a way to demonstrate to users how to use a feature or perform a task in the platform. You create a set of tour steps with callouts that point to appropriate UI elements, and provide the description or instruction to proceed. You select a specific event as a trigger in each step to advance to the next step.
Business logic to execute in response to an operation against a particular database record. These business rules may take declarative actions or include arbitrary scripting.
Server-side JavaScript classes available to the system
Controls to create a custom button or link on lists or forms to perform a particular action
Rules to enforce data integrity and policy
HTTP endpoints available to perform arbitrary scripting actions
Scripts available to the system to run on a schedule without needing a user transaction
Controls for registering events and associating them with a table
Custom scripts to run when the system receives a registered system event
Scripts to fix data, schema, or settings during an upgrade
Client-side JavaScript for running business logic on forms when certain browser events occur
Controls to specify what fields are visible and editable on a form based on its current content

UI scripts provide a way to package client-side JavaScript into a reusable form, similar to how script includes store server-side JavaScript. Administrators can create UI scripts and run them from client scripts and other client-side script objects and from HTML code.
Rules for assigning incidents based on certain value combinations
Rules for setting incident priority based on certain value combinations
Controls for automatically changing records values based on data lookup rules
Security tokens to control access to user interface elements such as menus, modules, tables, and fields
Controls for allowing users to view a page without having to log in or pass access controls
Application menus available for the application navigator - sys_app_application
Links available to display within application menus - sys_app_module
Controls for grouping modules in the application navigator - sys_ui_application
Controls for creating links to lists, UI pages, or reports in the application navigator - sys_ui_module
Email notifications available to the system - sysevent_email_action
Templates for creating email notifications - sysevent_email_template
Controls to specify how the system processes incoming email it receives - sysevent_in_email_action
sp_portal
sp_page
sp_widget
sp_theme
sp_js_include
sp_dependency
Group of pages that follow a set of consistent design elements such as the Employee Self-Service (ESS) portal - content_site
Collection of links to internal content, attachments, or external URLs - content_link
Group of style sheets that define the appearance of a site - content_theme
Content blocks for showing the details of a specific record - content_block_detail
Content blocks for Flash movies - content_block_flash
Content blocks for headers - content_block_header
Content blocks for iFrame containers - content_block_iframe
Content blocks for a list of records - content_block_lists
Content blocks for navigation menu containers - content_block_menu
Content blocks for dynamically-generated script data - content_block_programmatic
Content blocks for static HTML data - content_block_static
Collection of CSS style sheets, organized by theme - content_css
Pages available to create CMS sites - sys_portal_page
Image files available to the system - db_image
Video files available to the system - db_video
db_audio
Catalog items available to the Service Catalog - sc_cat_item
Catalog Items to create Task records from the Service Catalog - sc_cat_item_producer
Items and services end users can order from a catalog - sc_catalog
Categories to organize Service Catalog Items - sc_category
Fields to display when viewing Catalog Tasks, Catalog Items, and Requested Item Tasks - catalog_ui_policy
Group of variables shared between catalog items - item_option_new_set
Service Catalog items for providing information instead of goods or services - sc_cat_item_content
Execution Plans defining how to procure, configure and install Catalog Items - sc_cat_item_delivery_plan
Guides to order multiple related Catalog Items as a single request - sc_cat_item_guide
Client-side JavaScript for running business logic on catalog items or variable sets when certain browser events occur - catalog_script_client
Controls to create, display, and publish reports - sys_report
Metric controls for collecting report data - metric_definition
Reports to schedule for automatic generation and distribution by email - sysauto_report
Controls to define which colors a particular report uses - sys_report_chart_color
Colors available for reports to use - sys_report_color
Controls to define the label, color, and values included in a reported range - sys_report_range
Data sources are used to used to import data from external sources such as a file, JDBC database, or LDAP directory service - sys_data_source
v_ws_creator
Scheduled imports are used to schedule the import of data using data sources and can leverage transform maps - scheduled_import_set
Scripted REST APIs are used to create custom inbound REST APIs - sys_ws_definition
Scripted SOAP Web Services are used to create custom inbound SOAP Web Services - sys_web_service
Transform maps are used to transform data from an import set's temporary staging table to a target table - sys_transform_map
Export Definitions are used to define the data that will be included in an Export Set - sys_export_definition
Controls for exporting data to an external source - sys_export_set
Export Targets specify the target file on a MID server that Export Set data will be written to - sys_export_target
REST messages are used to make outbound HTTP requests to REST APIs - sys_rest_message

Scheduled Exports are used to specify a schedule when Export Sets will be run. A single export can be scheduled or regular intervals can be scheduled with support for including only delta records - scheduled_data_export
SOAP messages are used to make outbound HTTP requests to SOAP Web Services - sys_soap_message
Controls for automating multi-step processes with a sequence of activities - wf_workflow
Controls to automatically run a workflow on a schedule - wf_workflow_schedule
Schedule during which Changes may be performed - cmn_schedule
Schedule during which Changes are prohibited from being performed - cmn_schedule_blackout
Schedule during which maintenance may be performed on specific CIs - cmn_schedule_maintenance
Rick conditions for change requests - risk_conditions
Scheduling options for calculating a target time or duration - cmn_relative_duration
